com.intel.util

Class EnvironmentUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.util.EnvironmentUtil

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class EnvironmentUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to determine information about the device or environment the app is running in.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getDeviceIMEI

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getDeviceIMEI(@NonNull
                                                       android.content.Context context)
        Retrieves the device's IMEI number if available.
        Parameters:
        context - Android application context.
        Returns:
        The device IMEI number if the necessary permissions have been granted, and if it is available. Returns null otherwise.

      • isEmulator

        public static boolean isEmulator(@NonNull
                                 android.content.Context context)
        Determines if the device is an emulator. Because emulator detection is not a stable or public API in Android, this method only actively tries to detect whether the device is an emulator when this is a debug build.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        Returns:
        true if running on the emulator.

      • isOpenGlEs2Supported

        public static boolean isOpenGlEs2Supported(@NonNull
                                           android.content.Context context)
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        Returns:
        True if OpenGL ES 2.0 is supported. False if it is not supported.

      • isSdk11OrGreater

        public static boolean isSdk11OrGreater()
        Returns:
        true if Build.VERSION.SDK_INT is greater than or equal to 11.
